articles.author: Lauren Feiner
articles.title: Google is in more danger than ever of being broken up - The Verge
articles.description: Google will begin arguments to keep its Chrome browser in a remedies trial over its monopoly in search. It will soon face a trial over its monopoly in ad tech.
articles.content:
Google will fight to keep its Chrome browser in a search antitrust trial starting Monday, after losing an ad-tech suit.
Google will fight to keep its Chrome browser in a search antitrust trial start… [+5515 chars]

articles.title: Dark, Pitted, and Possibly Alien: The Skull Hill Rock That Has Scientists Stumped - SciTechDaily
articles.description: NASA’s Mars rover is on the trail of a geological mystery in the Jezero crater. While exploring an area known as Witch Hazel Hill, the rover encountered an intriguing dark rock named “Skull Hill” at a boundary between two different rock types. Although its co…
articles.content: This image from NASA’s Mars Perseverance rover, taken by the Mastcam-Z instrument’s right eye, shows the ‘Skull Hill’ target, a dark-toned float rock. The rover acquired this image while driving west… [+3201 chars]

articles.author: Kevin Purdy
articles.title: Synology confirms that higher-end NAS products will require its branded drives - Ars Technica
articles.description: Firm will later add “curated drive compatibility” lists after testing.
